page.title: 12Ipplepen Quarry
page.content: There are many{disused quarries}in this area. They were quarried for limestone, the stone was burnt in nearby lime kilns and the resulting lime spread on the fields as a {fertilizer.}Many of the{kilns}here are in a good state of preservation. The{quarry at Edgelands Lane}was used for this purpose but some of the rock had been metamorphosized and worked as marble.This was known as{Ipplepen {Marble.}It seems that quarry records, if they ever existed, have been lost. The quarry was in production in the mid 19th century.{Known examples}of the marble are the fireplaces at Rose- mount,East Street and Apsley House, Fore Street.The font of the parish church Ottery St. Mary is also made of Ipplepen marble. The{last known pieces were used for the fireplaces Little Pines, Rectory Road, East Ogwell.
